brief_summary.textblock:
AIM: Investigate wether there are differences in the parasympathetic nervous system in
      Parkinsons patients compared to controls.

      MATERIALS AND METHODS: We use the tracer [11C]donepezil to image the parasympathetic nervous
      system. The Investigators will include 20 Parkinsons patients and 20 healthy controls aged
      40-80 in our study. The participants will receive a careful medical examination, including a
      neurological examination, as part of the inclusion process. The subjects also have an MRI
      scan of the brain. Then PET/CT scans with [11C]donepezil are conducted - once for the upper
      abdominal region and once for the head region. For evaluating the function of the
      parasympathetic nervous system gastric emptying time, heart rate variability and salivary
      flow will be measured. These measureless will be correlated to the PET findings.

      PERSPECTIVES: The study will potentially result in the development of a PET ligand for
      imaging the parasympathetic nervous system. This will have applications for research in
      Parkinson's disease, diabetes, heart disease and other disorders, in which the autonomic
      nervous system is involved

clinical_study.brief_title: [11C]Donepezil PET For Imaging The Autonomous Nervous System In Parkinsons Disease

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age 40-80 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  dementia,

          -  psychiatric diseases,

          -  serious medical illness including any type of previous cancer

          -  any drug with known interaction with the autonomic nervous system

          -  metal in the body (because of MR scan)

          -  pregnancy or breast feeding (because of radiation due to PET/CT)

          -  known diseases of the salivary glands, stomach, intestines.

          -  Prior major surgery to salivary glands, esophagus, stomach.

study_pop.textblock:
Parkinson's patients with moderate symptoms (diagnosis > 4 years earlier, bilateral
        disease). Will be recruited through department of neurology Aarhus University Hospital,
        Denmark.

        Healthy controls recruited through local media.

facility.name: Dept. of Nuclear Medicine & PET Center, Aarhus University Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: [11C]DONEPEZIL PET FOR IMAGING THE AUTONOMOUS NERVOUS SYSTEM IN PARKINSONS DISEASE

overall_official.affiliation: Dept. of Nuclear Medicine & PET Center, Aarhus University Hospital, Aarhus, Denmark

oversight_info.authority: Denmark: Danish Health and Medicines Authority

primary_outcome.description: Our primary endpoint is the distribution volume of [11C]donepezil in internal organs (including salivary glands, heart, stomach and intestines) in Parkinson's patients compared to controls.
primary_outcome.measure: Distribution volume of [11C]donepezil in internal organs
primary_outcome.time_frame: The distribution volume of [11C]donepezil is measured at "Day 1" by PET/CT scanning each participant. The data analysis is done when all participants have completed the study.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: Fonden af 2. Juli 1984 til bekæmpelse af Parkinsons Sygdom

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Cross-Sectional
